intro: Curculigo scorzonerifolia, commonly known as the scarlet arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture and botanical gardens.
